ISDN Q.921-User Adaptation Layer
contents.zh-CHS: ISDN Q.921-用户适配层

contents.text: Status of this Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录的状况

contents.text: This document specifies an Internet standards track protocol for the Internet community, and requests discussion and suggestions for improvements. Please refer to the current edition of the "Internet Official Protocol Standards" (STD 1) for the standardization state and status of this protocol. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定了互联网社区的互联网标准跟踪协议，并要求进行讨论和提出改进建议。有关本协议的标准化状态和状态，请参考当前版本的“互联网官方协议标准”（STD 1）。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.zh-CHS: 版权公告

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This document defines a protocol for backhauling of ISDN Q.921 User messages over IP using the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP). This protocol would be used between a Signaling Gateway (SG) and Media Gateway Controller (MGC). It is assumed that the SG receives ISDN signaling over a standard ISDN interface.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了使用流控制传输协议（SCTP）通过IP回传ISDN Q.921用户消息的协议。该协议将在信令网关（SG）和媒体网关控制器（MGC）之间使用。假定SG通过标准ISDN接口接收ISDN信令。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: In this document, the term Q.921-User refers to an upper layer which uses the services of Q.921, not the user side of ISDN interface [1]. Examples of the upper layer would be Q.931 and QSIG.
contents.zh-CHS: 在本文件中，术语Q.921-用户是指使用Q.921服务的上层，而不是ISDN接口的用户端[1]。上层示例为Q.931和QSIG。

contents.text: This section describes the need for ISDN Q.921-User Adaptation (IUA) layer protocol as well as how this protocol shall be implemented.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节描述了ISDN Q.921-用户适配（IUA）层协议的需求以及该协议的实施方式。

contents.text: 1.1 Scope
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1 范围

contents.text: There is a need for Switched Circuit Network (SCN) signaling protocol delivery from an ISDN Signaling Gateway (SG) to a Media Gateway Controller (MGC) as described in the Framework Architecture for
contents.zh-CHS: 需要从ISDN信令网关（SG）到媒体网关控制器（MGC）的交换电路网络（SCN）信令协议交付，如架构框架中所述

contents.text: Signaling Transport [4]. The delivery mechanism SHOULD meet the following criteria:
contents.zh-CHS: 信号传输[4]。交付机制应符合以下标准：

contents.text: * Support for transport of the Q.921 / Q.931 boundary primitives * Support for communication between Layer Management modules on SG and MGC * Support for management of active associations between SG and MGC
contents.zh-CHS: * 支持Q.921/Q.931边界原语的传输*支持SG和MGC上图层管理模块之间的通信*支持SG和MGC之间活动关联的管理

contents.text: This document supports both ISDN Primary Rate Access (PRA) as well as Basic Rate Access (BRA) including the support for both point-to-point and point-to-multipoint modes of communication. This support includes Facility Associated Signaling (FAS), Non-Facility Associated Signaling (NFAS) and NFAS with backup D channel. QSIG adaptation layer requirements do not differ from Q.931 adaptation layer, hence; the procedures described in this document are also applicable for a QSIG adaptation layer. For simplicity, only Q.931 will be mentioned in the rest of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档支持ISDN主速率访问（PRA）和基本速率访问（BRA），包括对点对点和点对多点通信模式的支持。这种支持包括设施相关信令（FAS）、非设施相关信令（NFAS）和具有备用D信道的NFAS。QSIG适配层要求与Q.931适配层没有区别，因此；本文件中描述的程序也适用于QSIG适配层。为简单起见，本文档的其余部分将仅提及Q.931。

contents.text: 1.2 Terminology
contents.zh-CHS: 1.2 术语

contents.text: Interface - For the purposes of this document an interface supports the relevant ISDN signaling channel. This signaling channel MAY be a 16 kbps D channel for an ISDN BRA as well as 64 kbps primary or backup D channel for an ISDN PRA. For QSIG, the signaling channel is a Qc channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 接口-就本文件而言，接口支持相关ISDN信令信道。该信令信道可以是ISDN BRA的16 kbps D信道，以及ISDN PRA的64 kbps主或备用D信道。对于QSIG，信令信道是Qc信道。

contents.text: Q.921-User - Any protocol normally using the services of the ISDN Q.921 (e.g., Q.931, QSIG, etc.).
contents.zh-CHS: Q.921-用户-通常使用ISDN Q.921服务的任何协议（例如，Q.931、QSIG等）。

contents.text: Backhaul - A SG terminates the lower layers of an SCN protocol and backhauls the upper layer(s) to MGC for call processing. For the purposes of this document the SG terminates Q.921 and backhauls Q.931 to MGC.
contents.zh-CHS: 回程-SG终止SCN协议的下层，并将上层回程到MGC进行呼叫处理。就本文件而言，SG终止Q.921，并将Q.931回送至MGC。

contents.text: Association - An association refers to a SCTP association. The association will provide the transport for the delivery of Q.921-User protocol data units and IUA adaptation layer peer messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 关联-关联是指SCTP关联。该协会将提供Q.921用户协议数据单元和IUA适配层对等消息的传输。

contents.text: Stream - A stream refers to an SCTP stream; a uni-directional logical channel established from one SCTP endpoint to another associated SCTP endpoint, within which all user messages are delivered in-sequence except for those submitted to the un-ordered delivery service.
contents.zh-CHS: 流-流指SCTP流；从一个SCTP端点到另一个相关SCTP端点建立的单向逻辑通道，在该通道内，除提交给未排序传递服务的用户消息外，所有用户消息都按顺序传递。

contents.text: Interface Identifier - The Interface Identifier identifies the physical interface at the SG for which the signaling messages are sent/received. The format of the Interface Identifier parameter can be text or integer, the values of which are assigned according to
contents.zh-CHS: 接口标识符-接口标识符标识SG上发送/接收信令消息的物理接口。接口标识符参数的格式可以是文本或整数，其值根据

contents.text: network operator policy. The values used are of local significance only, coordinated between the SG and ASP. Significance is not implied across SGs served by an AS.
contents.zh-CHS: 网络运营商政策。使用的值仅具有局部意义，在SG和ASP之间进行协调。在AS服务的SGs中不暗示重要性。

contents.text: Application Server (AS) - A logical entity serving a specific application instance. An example of an Application Server is a MGC handling the Q.931 and call processing for D channels terminated by the Signaling Gateways. Practically speaking, an AS is modeled at the SG as an ordered list of one or more related Application Server Processes (e.g., primary, secondary, tertiary).
contents.zh-CHS: 应用程序服务器（AS）-为特定应用程序实例提供服务的逻辑实体。应用服务器的一个示例是MGC，它处理由信令网关终止的D个信道的Q.931和呼叫处理。实际上，AS在SG处被建模为一个或多个相关应用服务器进程（例如，主、次、三级）的有序列表。

contents.text: Application Server Process (ASP) - A process instance of an Application Server. Examples of Application Server Processes are primary or backup MGC instances.
contents.zh-CHS: 应用程序服务器进程（ASP）-应用程序服务器的进程实例。应用程序服务器进程的示例包括主MGC实例或备份MGC实例。

contents.text: Fail-over - The capability to re-route signaling traffic as required between related ASPs in the event of failure or unavailability of the currently used ASP (e.g., from primary MGC to back-up MGC). Fail-over also applies upon the return to service of a previously unavailable process.
contents.zh-CHS: 故障转移-在当前使用的ASP出现故障或不可用时（例如，从主MGC到备用MGC），根据需要在相关ASP之间重新路由信令流量的能力。故障转移也适用于以前不可用的进程恢复服务时。

contents.text: Layer Management - Layer Management is a nodal function that handles the inputs and outputs between the IUA layer and a local management entity.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理-层管理是处理IUA层和本地管理实体之间的输入和输出的节点功能。

contents.text: Network Byte Order - Most significant byte first, a.k.a Big Endian.
contents.zh-CHS: 网络字节顺序-最高有效字节优先，也称为大端字节。

contents.text: Host - The computing platform that the ASP process is running on.
contents.zh-CHS: 主机—运行ASP进程的计算平台。

contents.text: 1.3 IUA Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3 IUA概述

contents.text: The architecture that has been defined [4] for SCN signaling transport over IP uses multiple components, including an IP transport protocol, a signaling common transport protocol and an adaptation module to support the services expected by a particular SCN signaling protocol from its underlying protocol layer.
contents.zh-CHS: 为通过IP的SCN信令传输定义的架构[4]使用多个组件，包括IP传输协议、信令公共传输协议和适配模块，以支持特定SCN信令协议从其底层协议层期望的服务。

contents.text: This document defines an adaptation module that is suitable for the transport of ISDN Q.921-User (e.g., Q.931) messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件定义了适用于传输ISDN Q.921用户（如Q.931）消息的适配模块。

contents.text: 1.3.1 Example - SG to MGC
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3.1 示例-SG至MGC

contents.text: In a Signaling Gateway, it is expected that the ISDN signaling is received over a standard ISDN network termination. The SG then provides interworking of transport functions with IP Signaling Transport, in order to transport the Q.931 signaling messages to the MGC where the peer Q.931 protocol layer exists, as shown below:
contents.zh-CHS: 在信令网关中，期望通过标准ISDN网络终端接收ISDN信令。然后，SG提供传输功能与IP信令传输的互通，以便将Q.931信令消息传输到存在对等Q.931协议层的MGC，如下所示：

contents.text: NIF - Nodal Interworking Function EP - ISDN End Point SCTP - Stream Control Transmission Protocol (Refer to [3]) IUA - ISDN User Adaptation Layer Protocol
contents.zh-CHS: NIF-节点互通功能EP-ISDN端点SCTP-流控制传输协议（参考[3]）IUA-ISDN用户适配层协议

contents.text: It is recommended that the IUA use the services of the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) as the underlying reliable common signaling transport protocol. The use of SCTP provides the following features:
contents.zh-CHS: 建议IUA使用流控制传输协议（SCTP）的服务作为底层可靠的通用信令传输协议。SCTP的使用提供了以下功能：

contents.text: - explicit packet-oriented delivery (not stream-oriented) - sequenced delivery of user messages within multiple streams, with an option for order-of-arrival delivery of individual user messages, - optional multiplexing of user messages into SCTP datagrams, - network-level fault tolerance through support of multi-homing at either or both ends of an association, - resistance to flooding and masquerade attacks, and - data segmentation to conform to discovered path MTU size
contents.zh-CHS: - 显式面向数据包的交付（非面向流）-在多个流中按顺序交付用户消息，可选择单个用户消息的到达顺序交付，-可选择将用户消息多路复用为SCTP数据报，-通过支持关联任意端或两端的多宿主，实现网络级容错，-抵抗洪水和伪装攻击，以及-数据分割以符合发现的路径MTU大小

contents.text: There are scenarios without redundancy requirements and scenarios in which redundancy is supported below the transport layer. In these cases, the SCTP functions above MAY NOT be a requirement and TCP can be used as the underlying common transport protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: 有些场景没有冗余要求，有些场景在传输层下支持冗余。在这些情况下，上述SCTP功能可能不是必需的，TCP可以用作底层公共传输协议。

contents.text: 1.3.2 Support for the management of SCTP associations between the SG and ASPs
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3.2 支持管理SG和ASP之间的SCTP关联

contents.text: The IUA layer at the SG maintains the availability state of all dynamically registered remote ASPs, in order to manage the SCTP Associations and the traffic between the SG and ASPs. As well, the active/inactive state of remote ASP(s) are also maintained. Active ASPs are those currently receiving traffic from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: SG处的IUA层维护所有动态注册的远程ASP的可用性状态，以便管理SCTP关联以及SG和ASP之间的流量。此外，还将维护远程ASP的活动/非活动状态。活动ASP是当前从SG接收流量的ASP。

contents.text: The IUA layer MAY be instructed by local management to establish an SCTP association to a peer IUA node. This can be achieved using the M-SCTP ESTABLISH primitive to request, indicate and confirm the establishment of an SCTP association with a peer IUA node.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层可由本地管理层指示建立与对等IUA节点的SCTP关联。这可以通过使用M-SCTP建立原语来请求、指示和确认与对等IUA节点建立SCTP关联来实现。

contents.text: The IUA layer MAY also need to inform local management of the status of the underlying SCTP associations using the M-SCTP STATUS request and indication primitive. For example, the IUA MAY inform local management of the reason for the release of an SCTP association, determined either locally within the IUA layer or by a primitive from the SCTP.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层可能还需要使用M-SCTP状态请求和指示原语通知本地管理层底层SCTP关联的状态。例如，IUA可以通知本地管理层释放SCTP关联的原因，该关联由IUA层内本地确定或由来自SCTP的原语确定。

contents.text: 1.3.3 Signaling Network Architecture
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3.3 信令网络结构

contents.text: A Signaling Gateway is used to support the transport of Q.921-User signaling traffic to one or more distributed ASPs (e.g., MGCs). Clearly, the IUA protocol is not designed to meet the performance and reliability requirements for such transport by itself. However, the conjunction of distributed architecture and redundant networks does allow for a sufficiently reliable transport of signaling traffic over IP. The IUA protocol is flexible enough to allow its operation and management in a variety of physical configurations, enabling Network Operators to meet their performance and reliability requirements.
contents.zh-CHS: 信令网关用于支持将Q.921用户信令业务传输到一个或多个分布式ASP（例如，MGC）。显然，IUA协议本身并不是为了满足此类传输的性能和可靠性要求而设计的。然而，分布式体系结构和冗余网络的结合确实允许通过IP充分可靠地传输信令流量。IUA协议足够灵活，允许在各种物理配置中进行操作和管理，使网络运营商能够满足其性能和可靠性要求。

contents.text: To meet the ISDN signaling reliability and performance requirements for carrier grade networks, Network Operators SHOULD ensure that there is no single point of failure provisioned in the end-to-end network architecture between an ISDN node and an IP ASP.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了满足运营商级网络的ISDN信令可靠性和性能要求，网络运营商应确保在ISDN节点和IP ASP之间的端到端网络架构中不存在单点故障。

contents.text: Depending of course on the reliability of the SG and ASP functional elements, this can typically be met by the provision of redundant QOS-bounded IP network paths for SCTP Associations between SCTP End Points, and redundant Hosts, and redundant SGs. The distribution of ASPs within the available Hosts is also important. For a particular Application Server, the related ASPs SHOULD be distributed over at least two Hosts.
contents.zh-CHS: 当然，这取决于SG和ASP功能元件的可靠性，通常可以通过为SCTP端点、冗余主机和冗余SG之间的SCTP关联提供冗余QOS受限IP网络路径来实现。ASP在可用主机中的分布也很重要。对于特定的应用程序服务器，相关的ASP应至少分布在两台主机上。

contents.text: An example logical network architecture relevant to carrier-grade operation in the IP network domain is shown in Figure 1 below:
contents.zh-CHS: 与IP网络域中的运营商级操作相关的示例逻辑网络架构如下图1所示：

contents.text: Figure 2 - Logical Model Example
contents.zh-CHS: 图2-逻辑模型示例

contents.text: For carrier grade networks, the failure or isolation of a particular ASP SHOULD NOT cause stable calls to be dropped. This implies that ASPs need, in some cases, to share the call state or be able to pass the call state between each other. However, this sharing or communication of call state information is outside the scope of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 对于运营商级网络，特定ASP的故障或隔离不应导致稳定呼叫被丢弃。这意味着在某些情况下，ASP需要共享调用状态或能够在彼此之间传递调用状态。但是，呼叫状态信息的共享或通信不在本文档的范围之内。

contents.text: 1.3.4 ASP Fail-over Model and Terminology
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3.4 ASP故障转移模型和术语

contents.text: The IUA layer supports ASP fail-over functions in order to support a high availability of call processing capability. All Q.921-User messages incoming to an SG are assigned to a unique Application Server, based on the Interface Identifier of the message.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层支持ASP故障转移功能，以支持呼叫处理能力的高可用性。根据消息的接口标识符，传入SG的所有Q.921用户消息都分配给唯一的应用程序服务器。

contents.text: The Application Server is, in practical terms, a list of all ASPs configured to process Q.921-User messages from certain Interface Identifiers. One or more ASPs in the list are normally active (i.e., handling traffic) while any others MAY be unavailable or inactive, to be possibly used in the event of failure or unavailability of the active ASP(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 实际上，应用服务器是配置为处理来自特定接口标识符的Q.921用户消息的所有ASP的列表。列表中的一个或多个ASP通常处于活动状态（即处理流量），而任何其他ASP可能不可用或不活动，以便在活动ASP出现故障或不可用时使用。

contents.text: The fail-over model supports an n+k redundancy model, where n ASP(s) are the minimum number of redundant ASPs required to handle traffic and k ASPs are available to take over for a failed or unavailable ASP. Note that 1+1 active/standby redundancy is a subset of this model. A simplex 1+0 model is also supported as a subset, with no ASP redundancy.
contents.zh-CHS: 故障转移模型支持n+k冗余模型，其中n ASP（s）是处理流量所需的最小冗余ASP数量，k ASP可用于接管故障或不可用的ASP。请注意，1+1主动/备用冗余是该模型的一个子集。simplex 1+0模型也支持作为子集，没有ASP冗余。

contents.text: To avoid a single point of failure, it is recommended that a minimum of two ASPs be in the list, resident in separate hosts and therefore available over different SCTP Associations. For example, in the network shown in Figure 2, all messages from a particular D Channel (Interface Identifier) could be sent to ASP1 in Host1 or ASP1 in Host2. The AS list at SG1 might look like the following:
contents.zh-CHS: 为避免单点故障，建议列表中至少有两个ASP，驻留在不同的主机上，因此可通过不同的SCTP关联使用。例如，在图2所示的网络中，来自特定D通道（接口标识符）的所有消息都可以发送到Host1中的ASP1或Host2中的ASP1。SG1上的AS列表可能如下所示：

contents.text:
Interface Identifier(s) - Application Server #1
    ASP1/Host1  - State=Up, Active
    ASP1/Host2  - State=Up, Inactive

In this 1+1 redundancy case, ASP1 in Host1 would be sent any incoming message for the Interface Identifiers registered. ASP1 in Host2 would normally be brought to the active state upon failure of, or loss of connectivity to, ASP1/Host1. In this example, both ASPs are Up, meaning that the related SCTP association and far-end IUA peer is ready.
contents.zh-CHS: 在这种1+1冗余的情况下，Host1中的ASP1将被发送注册的接口标识符的任何传入消息。当ASP1/Host1发生故障或失去与ASP1的连接时，Host2中的ASP1通常会进入活动状态。在本例中，两个ASP都已启动，这意味着相关的SCTP关联和远端IUA对等已准备就绪。

contents.text: The AS List at SG1 might also be set up in load-share mode as shown below:
contents.zh-CHS: SG1上的AS列表也可以在负载共享模式下设置，如下所示：

contents.text:
Interface Identifier(s) - Application Server #1
    ASP1/Host1 - State=Up, Active
    ASP1/Host2 - State=Up, Active
In this case, both the ASPs would be sent a portion of the traffic.
contents.zh-CHS: 在这种情况下，两个ASP都将被发送一部分流量。

contents.text: In the process of fail-over, it is recommended that in the case of ASPs supporting call processing, stable calls do not get released. It is possible that calls in transition MAY fail, although measures of communication between the ASPs involved can be used to mitigate this problem. For example, the two ASPs MAY share call state via shared memory, or MAY use an ASP to ASP protocol to pass call state information. The ASP to ASP protocol is outside the scope of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 在故障转移过程中，建议在ASP支持呼叫处理的情况下，不要释放稳定的呼叫。转换中的调用可能会失败，尽管可以使用相关ASP之间的通信措施来缓解此问题。例如，两个ASP可以通过共享内存共享呼叫状态，或者可以使用ASP-to-ASP协议传递呼叫状态信息。ASP到ASP协议不在本文档的范围内。

contents.text: 1.3.5 Client/Server Model
contents.zh-CHS: 1.3.5 客户机/服务器模型

contents.text: It is recommended that the SG and ASP be able to support both client and server operation. The peer endpoints using IUA SHOULD be configured so that one always takes on the role of client and the
contents.zh-CHS: 建议SG和ASP能够同时支持客户端和服务器操作。应配置使用IUA的对等端点，以便始终扮演客户机和服务器的角色

contents.text: other the role of server for initiating SCTP associations. The default orientation would be for the SG to take on the role of server while the ASP is the client. In this case, ASPs SHOULD initiate the SCTP association to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: 其他服务器角色用于启动SCTP关联。默认情况下，SG将承担服务器角色，而ASP是客户端。在这种情况下，ASP应启动与SG的SCTP关联。

contents.text: The SCTP (and UDP/TCP) Registered User Port Number Assignment for IUA is 9900.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA的SCTP（和UDP/TCP）注册用户端口号分配为9900。

contents.text: 1.4 Services Provided by the IUA Layer
contents.zh-CHS: 1.4 IUA层提供的服务

contents.text: 1.4.1 Support for transport of Q.921/Q.931 boundary primitives
contents.zh-CHS: 1.4.1 支持Q.921/Q.931边界原语的传输

contents.text: In the backhaul scenario, the Q.921/Q.931 boundary primitives are exposed. IUA layer needs to support all of the primitives of this boundary to successfully backhaul Q.931.
contents.zh-CHS: 在回程场景中，将显示Q.921/Q.931边界原语。IUA层需要支持该边界的所有原语，才能成功回程Q.931。

contents.text: This includes the following primitives [1]:
contents.zh-CHS: 这包括以下原语[1]：

contents.text: DL-ESTABLISH
contents.zh-CHS: DL-建立

contents.text: The DL-ESTABLISH primitives are used to request, indicate and confirm the outcome of the procedures for establishing multiple frame operation.
contents.zh-CHS: DL-SETUP原语用于请求、指示和确认建立多帧操作的过程的结果。

contents.text: DL-RELEASE
contents.zh-CHS: DL-释放

contents.text: DL-RELEASE primitives are used to request, indicate, and confirm the outcome of the procedures for terminating a previously established multiple frame operation, or for reporting an unsuccessful establishment attempt.
contents.zh-CHS: DL-RELEASE原语用于请求、指示和确认终止先前建立的多帧操作或报告不成功的建立尝试的过程的结果。

contents.text: DL-DATA
contents.zh-CHS: DL-DATA

contents.text: The DL-DATA primitives are used to request and indicate layer 3 (Q.931) messages which are to be transmitted, or have been received, by the Q.921 layer using the acknowledged information transfer service.
contents.zh-CHS: DL-DATA原语用于请求和指示将由Q.921层使用确认信息传输服务传输或接收的第3层（Q.931）消息。

contents.text: DL-UNIT DATA
contents.zh-CHS: DL单元数据

contents.text: The DL-UNIT DATA primitives are used to request and indicate layer 3 (Q.931) messages which are to be transmitted, by the Q.921 layer using the unacknowledged information transfer service.
contents.zh-CHS: DL-UNIT数据原语用于请求和指示将由Q.921层使用未确认信息传输服务传输的第3层（Q.931）消息。

contents.text: 1.4.2 Support for communication between Layer Management modules on SG and MGC
contents.zh-CHS: 1.4.2 支持SG和MGC上的层管理模块之间的通信

contents.text: It is envisioned that the IUA layer needs to provide some services that will facilitate communication between Layer Management modules on the SG and MGC. These primitives are pointed out in [2], which are shown below:
contents.zh-CHS: 预计IUA层需要提供一些服务，以促进SG和MGC上的层管理模块之间的通信。[2]中指出了这些原语，如下所示：

contents.text: M-TEI STATUS
contents.zh-CHS: M-TEI状态

contents.text: The M-TEI STATUS primitives are used to request, confirm and indicate the status (assigned/unassigned) of a TEI.
contents.zh-CHS: M-TEI状态原语用于请求、确认和指示TEI的状态（已分配/未分配）。

contents.text: M-ERROR
contents.zh-CHS: M误差

contents.text: The M-ERROR primitive is used to indicate an error with a received IUA message (e.g., interface identifier value is not known to the SG).
contents.zh-CHS: M-ERROR原语用于指示接收到的IUA消息的错误（例如，SG不知道接口标识符值）。

contents.text: 1.4.3 Support for management of active associations between SG and MGC
contents.zh-CHS: 1.4.3 支持管理SG和MGC之间的活动关联

contents.text: A set of primitives between the IUA layer and the Layer Management are defined below to help the Layer Management manage the SCTP association(s) between the SG and MGC. The IUA layer can be instructed by the Layer Management to establish an SCTP association to a peer IUA node. This procedure can be achieved using the M-SCTP ESTABLISH primitive.
contents.zh-CHS: 下面定义了IUA层和层管理之间的一组原语，以帮助层管理管理SG和MGC之间的SCTP关联。层管理可以指示IUA层建立与对等IUA节点的SCTP关联。此过程可使用M-SCTP建立原语实现。

contents.text: M-SCTP ESTABLISH
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP建立

contents.text: The M-SCTP ESTABLISH primitives are used to request, indicate, and confirm the establishment of an SCTP association to a peer IUA node.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP建立原语用于请求、指示和确认建立到对等IUA节点的SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP RELEASE
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP释放

contents.text: The M-SCTP RELEASE primitives are used to request, indicate, and confirm the release of an SCTP association to a peer IUA node.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP释放原语用于请求、指示和确认向对等IUA节点释放SCTP关联。

contents.text: The IUA layer MAY also need to inform the status of the SCTP associations to the Layer Management. This can be achieved using the M-SCTP STATUS primitive.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层可能还需要向管理层通知SCTP关联的状态。这可以通过使用M-SCTP状态原语来实现。

contents.text: M-SCTP STATUS
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP状态

contents.text: The M-SCTP STATUS primitives are used to request and indicate the status of the underlying SCTP association(s).
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP状态原语用于请求和指示底层SCTP关联的状态。

contents.text: The Layer Management MAY need to inform the IUA layer of an AS/ASP status (i.e., failure, active, etc.), so that messages can be exchanged between IUA layer peers to stop traffic to the local IUA user. This can be achieved using the M-ASP STATUS primitive.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可能需要通知IUA层AS/ASP状态（即，故障、活动等），以便可以在IUA层对等方之间交换消息以停止到本地IUA用户的通信。这可以使用M-ASP状态原语实现。

contents.text: M-ASP STATUS
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP状态

contents.text: The ASP status is stored inside IUA layer on both the SG and MGC sides. The M-ASP STATUS primitive can be used by Layer Management to request the status of the Application Server Process from the IUA layer. This primitive can also be used to indicate the status of the Application Server Process.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP状态存储在SG和MGC两侧的IUA层内。层管理可以使用M-ASP状态原语从IUA层请求应用程序服务器进程的状态。此原语还可用于指示应用程序服务器进程的状态。

contents.text: M-ASP-UP
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-UP

contents.text: The M-ASP-UP primitive can be used by Layer Management to send a ASP Up message for the Application Server Process. It can also be used to generate an ASP Up Acknowledgement.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可以使用M-ASP-UP原语为应用程序服务器进程发送ASP UP消息。它还可用于生成ASP Up确认。

contents.text: M-ASP-DOWN
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-DOWN

contents.text: The M-ASP-DOWN primitive can be used by Layer Management to send a ASP Down message for the Application Server Process. It can also be used to generate an ASP Down Acknowledgement.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可以使用M-ASP-DOWN原语为应用程序服务器进程发送ASP DOWN消息。它还可用于生成ASP关闭确认。

contents.text: M-ASP-ACTIVE
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-ACTIVE

contents.text: The M-ASP-UP primitive can be used by Layer Management to send a ASP Active message for the Application Server Process. It can also be used to generate an ASP Active Acknowledgement.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可以使用M-ASP-UP原语为应用程序服务器进程发送ASP活动消息。它还可用于生成ASP活动确认。

contents.text: M-ASP-INACTIVE
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-1

contents.text: The M-ASP-UP primitive can be used by Layer Management to send a ASP Inactive message for the Application Server Process. It can also be used to generate an ASP Inactive Acknowledgement.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可以使用M-ASP-UP原语为应用程序服务器进程发送ASP非活动消息。它还可用于生成ASP非活动确认。

contents.text: M-AS STATUS
contents.zh-CHS: 并购地位

contents.text: The M-AS STATUS primitive can be used by Layer Management to request the status of the Application Server. This primitive can also be used to indicate the status of the Application Server.
contents.zh-CHS: 层管理可以使用M-AS STATUS原语请求应用程序服务器的状态。此原语还可用于指示应用程序服务器的状态。

contents.text: 1.5 Functions Implemented by the IUA Layer
contents.zh-CHS: 1.5 IUA层实现的功能

contents.text: 1.5.1 Mapping

The IUA layer MUST maintain a map of the Interface Identifier to a physical interface on the Signaling Gateway. A physical interface would be a T1 line, E1 line, etc., and could include the TDM timeslot. In addition, for a given interface the SG MUST be able to identify the associated signaling channel. IUA layers on both SG and MGC MAY maintain the status of TEIs and SAPIs.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层必须维护接口标识符到信令网关上物理接口的映射。物理接口可以是T1线、E1线等，并且可以包括TDM时隙。此外，对于给定接口，SG必须能够识别相关的信令信道。SG和MGC上的IUA层可保持TEI和SAPI的状态。

contents.text: The SG maps an Interface Identifier to an SCTP association/stream only when an ASP sends an ASP Active message for a particular Interface Identifier. It MUST be noted, however, that this mapping is dynamic and could change at any time due to a change of ASP state. This mapping could even temporarily be invalid, for example during failover of one ASP to another. Therefore, the SG MUST maintain the states of AS/ASP and reference them during the routing of an messages to an AS/ASP.
contents.zh-CHS: 只有当ASP发送特定接口标识符的ASP活动消息时，SG才会将接口标识符映射到SCTP关联/流。但是，必须注意的是，此映射是动态的，并且可能由于ASP状态的更改而随时更改。此映射甚至可能暂时无效，例如在一个ASP到另一个ASP的故障切换期间。因此，SG必须维护AS/ASP的状态，并在将消息路由到AS/ASP期间引用这些状态。

contents.text: One example of the logical view of relationship between D channel, Interface Identifier, AS and ASP in the SG is shown below:
contents.zh-CHS: SG中D通道、接口标识符、AS和ASP之间关系的逻辑视图的一个示例如下所示：

contents.text: where IID = Interface Identifier
contents.zh-CHS: 其中IID=接口标识符

contents.text: Note that an ASP can be in more than one AS.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，ASP可以在多个AS中。

contents.text: 1.5.2 Status of ASPs
contents.zh-CHS: 1.5.2 ASPs的现状

contents.text: The IUA layer on the SG MUST maintain the state of the ASPs it is supporting. The state of an ASP changes because of reception of peer-to-peer messages (ASPM messages as described in Section 3.3.2) or reception of indications from the local SCTP association. ASP state transition procedures are described in Section 4.3.1.
contents.zh-CHS: SG上的IUA层必须保持其支持的ASP的状态。由于接收到对等消息（如第3.3.2节所述的ASPM消息）或接收到来自本地SCTP协会的指示，ASP的状态会发生变化。ASP状态转换程序见第4.3.1节。

contents.text: At a SG, an Application Server list MAY contain active and inactive ASPs to support ASP load-sharing and fail-over procedures. When, for example, both a primary and a back-up ASP are available, IUA peer protocol is required to control which ASP is currently active. The ordered list of ASPs within a logical Application Server is kept updated in the SG to reflect the active Application Server Process(es).
contents.zh-CHS: 在SG，应用服务器列表可能包含活动和非活动ASP，以支持ASP负载共享和故障转移过程。例如，当主ASP和备份ASP都可用时，需要IUA对等协议来控制当前活动的ASP。逻辑应用程序服务器中的ASP有序列表在SG中保持更新，以反映活动的应用程序服务器进程。

contents.text: Also the IUA layer MAY need to inform the local management of the change in status of an ASP or AS. This can be achieved using the M-ASP STATUS or M-AS STATUS primitives.
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，IUA层可能需要通知本地管理层ASP或AS状态的变化。这可以使用M-ASP状态或M-AS状态原语实现。

contents.text: 1.5.3 SCTP Stream Management

SCTP allows a user specified number of streams to be opened during the initialization. It is the responsibility of the IUA layer to ensure proper management of these streams. Because of the unidirectional nature of streams, an IUA layer is not aware of the stream number to Interface Identifier mapping of its peer IUA layer. Instead, the Interface Identifier is in the IUA message header.
contents.zh-CHS: SCTP允许在初始化期间打开用户指定数量的流。IUA层负责确保这些流的正确管理。由于流的单向性，IUA层不知道其对等IUA层的流号到接口标识符的映射。相反，接口标识符位于IUA消息头中。

contents.text: The use of SCTP streams within IUA is recommended in order to minimize transmission and buffering delay, therefore improving the overall performance and reliability of the signaling elements. It is recommended that a separate SCTP stream is used for each D channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 建议在IUA中使用SCTP流，以最小化传输和缓冲延迟，从而提高信令元件的整体性能和可靠性。建议为每个D通道使用单独的SCTP流。

contents.text: 1.5.4 Seamless Network Management Interworking
contents.zh-CHS: 1.5.4 无缝网络管理互通

contents.text: The IUA layer on the SG SHOULD pass an indication of unavailability of the IUA-User (Q.931) to the local Layer Management, if the currently active ASP moves from the ACTIVE state. The Layer Management could instruct Q.921 to take some action, if it deems appropriate.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果当前活动的ASP从活动状态移动，则SG上的IUA层应将IUA用户不可用的指示（Q.931）传递给本地层管理。如果层管理层认为合适，可以指示Q.921采取一些措施。

contents.text: Likewise, if an SCTP association fails, the IUA layer on both the SG and ASP sides MAY generate Release primitives to take the data links out-of-service.
contents.zh-CHS: 同样，如果SCTP关联失败，SG和ASP双方的IUA层可能会生成释放原语，以使数据链路停止服务。

contents.text: 1.5.5 Congestion Management
contents.zh-CHS: 1.5.5 拥挤管理

contents.text: If the IUA layer becomes congested (implementation dependent), it MAY stop reading from the SCTP association to flow control from the peer IUA.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果IUA层变得拥挤（取决于实现），它可能会停止从SCTP关联读取来自对等IUA的流控制。

contents.text: 1.6 Definition of IUA Boundaries
contents.zh-CHS: 1.6 IUA边界的定义

contents.text: 1.6.1 Definition of IUA/Q.921 boundary
contents.zh-CHS: 1.6.1 IUA/Q.921边界的定义

contents.text: DL-ESTABLISH DL-RELEASE DL-DATA DL-UNIT DATA
contents.zh-CHS: DL-建立DL-发布DL-数据DL-单元数据

contents.text: 1.6.2 Definition of IUA/Q.931 boundary
contents.zh-CHS: 1.6.2 IUA/Q.931边界的定义

contents.text: DL-ESTABLISH DL-RELEASE DL-DATA DL-UNIT DATA
contents.zh-CHS: DL-建立DL-发布DL-数据DL-单元数据

contents.text: 1.6.3 Definition of SCTP/IUA Boundary
contents.zh-CHS: 1.6.3 SCTP/IUA边界的定义

contents.text: An example of the upper layer primitives provided by SCTP are available in Reference [3] section 10.
contents.zh-CHS: 参考文献[3]第10节提供了SCTP提供的上层原语示例。

contents.text: 1.6.4 Definition of IUA/Layer-Management Boundary
contents.zh-CHS: 1.6.4 IUA/层管理边界的定义

contents.text: M-SCTP ESTABLISH request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to establish an SCTP association with an SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP建立请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP与SG建立SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-STCP ESTABLISH confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP confirms to LM that it has established an SCTP association with an SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-STCP建立确认方向：IUA->LM目的：ASP向LM确认其已与SG建立SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP ESTABLISH indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: SG informs LM that an ASP has established an SCTP association.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP建立指示方向：IUA->LM目的：SG通知LM ASP已建立SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP RELEASE request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to release an SCTP association with SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP发布请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP发布与SG的SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP RELEASE confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP confirms to LM that it has released SCTP association with SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP发布确认方向：IUA->LM目的：ASP向LM确认其已发布与SG的SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP RELEASE indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: SG informs LM that ASP has released an SCTP association.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP发布指示方向：IUA->LM目的：SG通知LM ASP已发布SCTP关联。

contents.text: M-SCTP STATUS request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests IUA to report status of SCTP association.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP状态请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求IUA报告SCTP关联状态。

contents.text: M-SCTP STATUS indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: IUA reports status of SCTP association.
contents.zh-CHS: M-SCTP状态指示方向：IUA->LM目的：IUA报告SCTP关联的状态。

contents.text: M-ASP STATUS request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests SG to report status of remote ASP.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP状态请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求SG报告远程ASP的状态。

contents.text: M-ASP STATUS indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: SG reports status of remote ASP.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP状态指示方向：IUA->LM目的：SG报告远程ASP的状态。

contents.text: M-AS-STATUS request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests SG to report status of AS.
contents.zh-CHS: M-AS-STATUS请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求SG报告AS的状态。

contents.text: M-AS-STATUS indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: SG reports status of AS.
contents.zh-CHS: M-AS状态指示方向：IUA->LM目的：SG报告AS状态。

contents.text: M-NOTIFY indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that it has received a NOTIFY message from its peer.
contents.zh-CHS: M-NOTIFY指示方向：IUA->LM目的：ASP报告它已收到来自其对等方的NOTIFY消息。

contents.text: M-ERROR indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP or SG reports that it has received an ERROR message from its peer.
contents.zh-CHS: M-错误指示方向：IUA->LM目的：ASP或SG报告它已收到来自其对等方的错误消息。

contents.text: M-ASP-UP request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to start its operation and send an ASP UP message to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-UP请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP启动其操作并向SG发送ASP UP消息。

contents.text: M-ASP-UP confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received an ASP UP Acknowledgement message from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-UP确认方向：IUA->LM目的：收到来自SG的ASP UP确认消息的ASP报告。

contents.text: M-ASP-DOWN request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to stop its operation and send an ASP DOWN message to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-DOWN请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP停止其操作并向SG发送ASP DOWN消息。

contents.text: M-ASP-DOWN confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received an ASP DOWN Acknowledgement message from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-DOWN确认方向：IUA->LM目的：已收到来自SG的ASP DOWN确认消息的ASP报告。

contents.text: M-ASP-ACTIVE request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to send an ASP ACTIVE message to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-ACTIVE请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP向SG发送ASP活动消息。

contents.text: M-ASP-ACTIVE confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received an ASP ACTIVE Acknowledgement message from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-ACTIVE确认方向：IUA->LM目的：已收到来自SG的ASP ACTIVE确认消息的ASP报告。

contents.text: M-ASP-INACTIVE request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to send an ASP INACTIVE message to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-INACTIVE请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP向SG发送ASP INACTIVE消息。

contents.text: M-ASP-INACTIVE confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received an ASP INACTIVE Acknowledgement message from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-ASP-INACTIVE确认方向：IUA->LM目的：接收到来自SG的ASP INACTIVE确认消息的ASP报告。

contents.text: M-TEI STATUS request Direction: LM -> IUA Purpose: LM requests ASP to send a TEI status request to the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-TEI状态请求方向：LM->IUA目的：LM请求ASP向SG发送TEI状态请求。

contents.text: M-TEI STATUS indication Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received a TEI status indication from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-TEI状态指示方向：IUA->LM目的：ASP报告已从SG接收到TEI状态指示。

contents.text: M-TEI STATUS confirm Direction: IUA -> LM Purpose: ASP reports that is has received a TEI status confirm from the SG.
contents.zh-CHS: M-TEI状态确认方向：IUA->LM目的：已从SG收到TEI状态确认的ASP报告。

contents.text: 2.0 Conventions
contents.zh-CHS: 2.0 习俗

contents.text: The keywords MUST, MUST NOT, REQUIRED, SHALL, SHALL NOT, SHOULD, SHOULD NOT, RECOMMENDED, NOT RECOMMENDED, MAY, and OPTIONAL, when they appear in this document, are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中出现的关键词必须、不得、必需、应、不应、应、不应、推荐、不推荐、可和可选时，应按照[RFC2119]中的说明进行解释。

contents.text: 3.0 Protocol Elements
contents.zh-CHS: 3.0 协议要素

contents.text: This section describes the format of various messages used in this protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍本协议中使用的各种消息的格式。

contents.text: 3.1 Common Message Header
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1 公共消息头

contents.text: The protocol messages for Q.921-User Adaptation require a message header which contains the adaptation layer version, the message type, and message length.
contents.zh-CHS: 用于Q.921-用户自适应的协议消息需要包含自适应层版本、消息类型和消息长度的消息头。

contents.text: Figure 3 Common Header Format
contents.zh-CHS: 图3通用标题格式

contents.text: All fields in an IUA message MUST be transmitted in the network byte order, unless otherwise stated.
contents.zh-CHS: 除非另有说明，IUA消息中的所有字段必须以网络字节顺序传输。

contents.text: 3.1.1 Version
The version field contains the version of the IUA adaptation layer. The supported versions are the following:
contents.zh-CHS: 版本字段包含IUA适配层的版本。支持的版本如下：

contents.text:
Value    Version
-----    -------
  1      Release 1.0
3.1.2 Message Classes and Types
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.2 消息类和类型

contents.text: The following List contains the valid Message Classes:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下列表包含有效的消息类：

contents.text: Message Class: 8 bits (unsigned integer)
contents.zh-CHS: 消息类：8位（无符号整数）

contents.text:
0      Management (MGMT) Message [IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA]
1      Transfer Messages [M3UA]
2      SS7 Signalling Network Management (SSNM) Messages [M3UA/SUA]
3      ASP State Maintenance (ASPSM) Messages [IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA]
4      ASP Traffic Maintenance (ASPTM) Messages [IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA]
5      Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport (QPTM)
       Messages [IUA]
6      MTP2 User Adaptation (MAUP) Messages [M2UA]
7      Connectionless Messages [SUA]
8 Connection-Oriented Messages [SUA] 9 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined Message Class extensions
contents.zh-CHS: 8 IETF保留的面向连接的消息[SUA]9至127 128至255为IETF定义的消息类扩展保留

contents.text: The following list contains the message names for the defined messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下列表包含已定义消息的消息名称。

contents.text: Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport (QPTM) Messages
contents.zh-CHS: Q.921/Q.931边界原语传输（QPTM）消息

contents.text: 0 Reserved 1 Data Request Message 2 Data Indication Message 3 Unit Data Request Message 4 Unit Data Indication Message 5 Establish Request 6 Establish Confirm 7 Establish Indication 8 Release Request 9 Release Confirm 10 Release Indication 11 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined QPTM extensions
contents.zh-CHS: 0保留1数据请求消息2数据指示消息3单元数据请求消息4单元数据指示消息5建立请求6建立确认7建立指示8发布请求9发布确认10发布指示11至127由IETF保留128至255为IETF定义的QPTM扩展保留

contents.text: Application Server Process State Maintenance (ASPSM) messages
contents.zh-CHS: 应用程序服务器进程状态维护（ASPSM）消息

contents.text: 0 Reserved 1 ASP Up (UP) 2 ASP Down (DOWN) 3 Heartbeat (BEAT) 4 ASP Up Ack (UP ACK) 5 ASP Down Ack (DOWN ACK) 6 Heatbeat Ack (BEAT ACK) 7 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined ASPSM extensions
contents.zh-CHS: 0保留1 ASP向上（向上）2 ASP向下（向下）3心跳（节拍）4 ASP向上确认（向上确认）5 ASP向下确认（向下确认）6热拍确认（节拍确认）7到127由IETF保留128到255为IETF定义的ASPSM扩展保留

contents.text: Application Server Process Traffic Maintenance (ASPTM) messages
contents.zh-CHS: 应用程序服务器进程流量维护（ASPTM）消息

contents.text: 0 Reserved 1 ASP Active (ACTIVE) 2 ASP Inactive (INACTIVE) 3 ASP Active Ack (ACTIVE ACK) 4 ASP Inactive Ack (INACTIVE ACK) 5 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined ASPTM extensions
contents.zh-CHS: 0保留1 ASP活动（活动）2 ASP非活动（非活动）3 ASP活动确认（活动确认）4 ASP非活动确认（非活动确认）5到127由IETF保留128到255为IETF定义的ASPTM扩展保留

contents.text: Management (MGMT) Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 管理（MGMT）消息

contents.text: 0 Error (ERR) 1 Notify (NTFY) 2 TEI Status Request 3 TEI Status Confirm 4 TEI Status Indication 5 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined MGMT extensions
contents.zh-CHS: 0错误（错误）1通知（NTFY）2 TEI状态请求3 TEI状态确认4 TEI状态指示5到127由IETF保留128到255为IETF定义的管理扩展保留

contents.text: 3.1.3 Reserved
The Reserved field is 8-bits. It SHOULD be set to all '0's and ignored by the receiver.
contents.zh-CHS: 保留字段为8位。它应设置为所有“0”，并被接收器忽略。

contents.text: 3.1.4 Message Length
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.4 消息长度

contents.text: The Message length defines the length of the message in octets, including the Common header.
contents.zh-CHS: 消息长度以八位字节定义消息的长度，包括公共头。

contents.text: 3.1.5 Variable-Length Parameter Format
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.5 可变长度参数格式

contents.text: IUA messages consist of a Common Header followed by zero or more variable-length parameters, as defined by the message type. The variable-length parameters contained in a message are defined in a Tag-Length-Value format as shown below.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA消息由一个公共头和零个或多个可变长度参数组成，这些参数由消息类型定义。消息中包含的可变长度参数以标记长度值格式定义，如下所示。

contents.text: Mandatory parameters MUST be placed before optional parameters in a message.
contents.zh-CHS: 在消息中，必须将强制参数置于可选参数之前。

contents.text: Parameter Tag: 16 bits (unsigned integer)
contents.zh-CHS: 参数标记：16位（无符号整数）

contents.text: The Tag field is a 16 bit identifier of the type of parameter. It takes a value of 0 to 65534.
contents.zh-CHS: 标记字段是参数类型的16位标识符。它的值为0到65534。

contents.text: The value of 65535 is reserved for IETF-defined extensions. Values other than those defined in specific parameter description are reserved for use by the IETF.
contents.zh-CHS: 65535的值保留给IETF定义的扩展。特定参数描述中定义的值以外的值保留供IETF使用。

contents.text: Parameter Length: 16 bits (unsigned integer)
contents.zh-CHS: 参数长度：16位（无符号整数）

contents.text: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes, including the Parameter Tag, Parameter Length, and Parameter Value fields. The Parameter Length does not include any padding bytes.
contents.zh-CHS: 参数长度字段包含以字节为单位的参数大小，包括参数标记、参数长度和参数值字段。参数长度不包括任何填充字节。

contents.text: Parameter Value: variable-length
contents.zh-CHS: 参数值：可变长度

contents.text: The Parameter Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the parameter.
contents.zh-CHS: 参数值字段包含要在参数中传输的实际信息。

contents.text: The total length of a parameter (including Tag, Parameter Length and Value fields) MUST be a multiple of 4 bytes. If the length of the parameter is not a multiple of 4 bytes, the sender pads the Parameter at the end (i.e., after the Parameter Value field) with all zero bytes. The length of the padding is NOT included in the parameter length field. A sender SHOULD NEVER pad with more than 3 bytes. The receiver MUST ignore the padding bytes.
contents.zh-CHS: 参数的总长度（包括标记、参数长度和值字段）必须是4字节的倍数。如果参数的长度不是4字节的倍数，则发送方在参数末尾（即参数值字段之后）填充所有零字节。填充的长度不包括在参数长度字段中。发送方的填充长度不应超过3个字节。接收器必须忽略填充字节。

contents.text: 3.2 IUA Message Header
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2 消息头

contents.text: In addition to the common message header, there will be a specific message header for QPTM and the TEI Status MGMT messages. The IUA message header will immediately follow the Common header in these messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 除了通用消息头之外，QPTM和TEI状态管理消息还有一个特定的消息头。IUA消息头将紧跟在这些消息中的公共头之后。

contents.text: This message header will contain the Interface Identifier and Data Link Connection Identifier (DLCI). The Interface Identifier identifies the physical interface terminating the signaling channel at the SG for which the signaling messages are sent/received. The format of the Interface Identifier parameter can be text or integer. The Interface Identifiers are assigned according to network operator policy. The integer values used are of local significance only, coordinated between the SG and ASP.
contents.zh-CHS: 此消息头将包含接口标识符和数据链路连接标识符（DLCI）。接口标识符标识在SG处终止信令信道的物理接口，信令消息针对该物理接口被发送/接收。接口标识符参数的格式可以是文本或整数。根据网络运营商策略分配接口标识符。使用的整数值仅具有局部意义，在SG和ASP之间进行协调。

contents.text: The integer formatted Interface Identifier MUST be supported. The text formatted Interface Identifier MAY optionally be supported.
contents.zh-CHS: 必须支持整数格式的接口标识符。可以选择支持文本格式的接口标识符。

contents.text: Figure 4 IUA Message Header (Integer-based Interface Identifier)
contents.zh-CHS: 图4 IUA消息头（基于整数的接口标识符）

contents.text: The Tag value for the Integer-based Interface Identifier is 0x1. The length is always set to a value of 8.
contents.zh-CHS: 基于整数的接口标识符的标记值为0x1。长度始终设置为8的值。

contents.text: | Interface Identifier (text) |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符（文本）|

contents.text: Figure 5 IUA Message Header (Text-based Interface Identifier)
contents.zh-CHS: 图5 IUA消息头（基于文本的接口标识符）

contents.text: The Tag value for the Text-based Interface Identifier is 0x3. The length is variable.
contents.zh-CHS: 基于文本的接口标识符的标记值为0x3。长度是可变的。

contents.text: The DLCI format is shown below in Figure 6.
contents.zh-CHS: DLCI格式如下图6所示。

contents.text: Figure 6 DLCI Format
contents.zh-CHS: 图6 DLCI格式

contents.text: SPR: Spare 2nd bit in octet 1, (1 bit)
contents.zh-CHS: SPR：八位组1中的备用第二位（1位）

contents.text: SAPI: Service Access Point Identifier, 3rd through 8th bits in octet 1 (6 bits)
contents.zh-CHS: SAPI：服务接入点标识符，八位组1中的第3位到第8位（6位）

contents.text: TEI: Terminal Endpoint Identifier, 2nd through 8th bits in octet 2 (7 bits)
contents.zh-CHS: TEI：终端端点标识符，八位字节2中的第2位到第8位（7位）

contents.text: The DLCI field (including the SAPI and TEI) is coded in accordance with Q.921.
contents.zh-CHS: DLCI字段（包括SAPI和TEI）按照Q.921进行编码。

contents.text: 3.3 IUA Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3 IUA信息

contents.text: The following section defines the messages and parameter contents. The IUA messages will use the common message header (Figure 3) and the IUA message header (Figure 4 and Figure 5).
contents.zh-CHS: 以下部分定义了消息和参数内容。IUA消息将使用公共消息头（图3）和IUA消息头（图4和图5）。

contents.text: 3.3.1 Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport (QPTM) Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1 Q.921/Q.931边界原语传输（QPTM）消息

contents.text: 3.3.1.1 Establish Messages (Request, Confirm, Indication)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1.1 建立消息（请求、确认、指示）

contents.text: The Establish Messages are used to establish a data link on the signaling channel or to confirm that a data link on the signaling channel has been established. The MGC controls the state of the D channel. When the MGC desires the D channel to be in-service, it will send the Establish Request message.
contents.zh-CHS: 建立消息用于在信令信道上建立数据链路或确认已在信令信道上建立数据链路。MGC控制D通道的状态。当MGC希望D通道处于服务状态时，它将发送建立请求消息。

contents.text: When the MGC sends an IUA Establish Request message, the MGC MAY start a timer. This timer would be stopped upon receipt of an IUA Establish Confirm or Establish Indication. If the timer expires, the MGC would re-send the IUA Establish Request message and restart the timer. In other words, the MGC MAY continue to request the establishment of the data link on periodic basis until the desired state is achieved or take some other action (notify the Management Layer).
contents.zh-CHS: 当MGC发送IUA建立请求消息时，MGC可以启动计时器。收到IUA建立确认或建立指示后，该计时器将停止。如果计时器过期，MGC将重新发送IUA建立请求消息并重新启动计时器。换言之，MGC可以继续定期请求建立数据链路，直到达到所需状态，或者采取一些其他行动（通知管理层）。

contents.text: When the SG receives an IUA Establish Request from the MGC, the SG shall send the Q.921 Establish Request primitive to the its Q.921 entity. In addition, the SG shall map any response received from the Q.921 entity to the appropriate message to the MGC. For example, if the Q.921 entity responds with a Q.921 Establish Confirm primitive, the IUA layer shall map this to an IUA Establish Confirm message. As another example, if the IUA Layer receives a Q.921 Release Confirm or Release Indication as an apparent response to the Q.921 Establish Request primitive, the IUA Layer shall map these to the corresponding IUA Release Confirm or Release Indication messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 当SG收到来自MGC的IUA建立请求时，SG应将Q.921建立请求原语发送给its Q.921实体。此外，SG应将从Q.921实体收到的任何响应映射到MGC的适当消息。例如，如果Q.921实体响应Q.921建立确认原语，则IUA层应将其映射到IUA建立确认消息。作为另一个示例，如果IUA层接收到Q.921发布确认或发布指示，作为对Q.921建立请求原语的明显响应，则IUA层应将其映射到相应的IUA发布确认或发布指示消息。

contents.text: The Establish messages contain the common message header followed by IUA message header. It does not contain any additional parameters.
contents.zh-CHS: 建立消息包含公共消息头，后跟IUA消息头。它不包含任何附加参数。

contents.text: 3.3.1.2 Release Messages (Request, Indication, Confirmation)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1.2 发布消息（请求、指示、确认）

contents.text: The Release Request message is used to release the data link on the signaling channel. The Release Confirm and Indication messages are used to indicate that the data link on the signaling channel has been released.
contents.zh-CHS: 释放请求消息用于释放信令信道上的数据链路。释放确认和指示消息用于指示信令信道上的数据链路已被释放。

contents.text: If a response to the Release Request message is not received, the MGC MAY resend the Release Request message. If no response is received, the MGC can consider the data link as being released. In this case, signaling traffic on that D channel is not expected from the SG and signaling traffic will not be sent to the SG for that D channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果未收到对释放请求消息的响应，则MGC可重新发送释放请求消息。如果没有接收到响应，MGC可以考虑数据链路被释放。在这种情况下，该D信道上的信令业务预计不会来自SG，并且该D信道的信令业务将不会被发送到SG。

contents.text: The Release messages contain the common message header followed by IUA message header. The Release confirm message is in response to a Release Request message and it does not contain any additional parameters. The Release Request and Indication messages contain the following parameter:
contents.zh-CHS: 发布消息包含公共消息头，后跟IUA消息头。释放确认消息是对释放请求消息的响应，它不包含任何附加参数。释放请求和指示消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: REASON
contents.zh-CHS: 原因

contents.text: The valid values for Reason are shown in the following table.
contents.zh-CHS: 下表显示了合理的有效值。

contents.text: Define Value Description RELEASE_MGMT 0x0 Management layer generated release. RELEASE_PHYS 0x1 Physical layer alarm generated release. RELEASE_DM 0x2 Specific to a request. Indicates Layer 2 SHOULD release and deny all requests from far end to establish a data link on the signaling channel (i.e., if SABME is received send a DM) RELEASE_OTHER 0x3 Other reasons
contents.zh-CHS: 定义值描述发布管理0x0管理层生成的发布。释放\u PHYS 0x1物理层警报生成释放。释放特定于请求的DM 0x2。指示第2层应释放并拒绝来自远端的所有请求，以在信令信道上建立数据链路（即，如果接收到SABME，则发送DM）释放\u其他0x3其他原因

contents.text: Note: Only RELEASE_MGMT, RELEASE_DM and RELEASE_OTHER are valid reason codes for a Release Request message.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：只有RELEASE_MGMT、RELEASE_DM和RELEASE_OTHER是发布请求消息的有效原因码。

contents.text: 3.3.1.3 Data Messages (Request, Indication)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1.3 数据信息（请求、指示）

contents.text: The Data message contains an ISDN Q.921-User Protocol Data Unit (PDU) corresponding to acknowledged information transfer service.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据报文包含一个ISDN Q.921用户协议数据单元（PDU），对应于已确认的信息传输服务。

contents.text: The Data messages contain the common message header followed by IUA message header. The Data message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: 数据消息包含公共消息头，后跟IUA消息头。数据消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: PROTOCOL DATA
contents.zh-CHS: 协议数据

contents.text: | Protocol Data |
contents.zh-CHS: |协议数据|

contents.text: The protocol data contains upper layer signaling message e.g. Q.931, QSIG.
contents.zh-CHS: 协议数据包含上层信令消息，例如Q.931、QSIG。

contents.text: 3.3.1.4 Unit Data Messages (Request, Indication)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.1.4 机组数据信息（请求、指示）

contents.text: The Unit Data message contains an ISDN Q.921-User Protocol Data Unit (PDU) corresponding to unacknowledged information transfer service.
contents.zh-CHS: 单元数据消息包含对应于未确认信息传输服务的ISDN Q.921用户协议数据单元（PDU）。

contents.text: The Unit Data messages contain the common message header followed by IUA message header. The Unit Data message contains the following parameters
contents.zh-CHS: 单元数据消息包含公共消息头，后跟IUA消息头。机组数据信息包含以下参数

contents.text: PROTOCOL DATA
contents.zh-CHS: 协议数据

contents.text: | Protocol Data |
contents.zh-CHS: |协议数据|

contents.text: 3.3.2 Application Server Process Maintenance (ASPM) Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2 应用程序服务器进程维护（ASPM）消息

contents.text: The ASPM messages will only use the common message header.
contents.zh-CHS: ASPM消息将仅使用公共消息头。

contents.text: 3.3.2.1 ASP Up (ASPUP)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.1 ASP Up（ASUP）

contents.text: The ASP Up (ASPUP) message is sent by an ASP to indicate to an SG that it is ready to receive traffic or maintenance messages.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Up（ASPUP）消息由ASP发送，以向SG指示其已准备好接收流量或维护消息。

contents.text: The ASPUP message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPUP消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Info String (optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for ASPUP Message parameters is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPUP消息参数的格式如下所示：

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The optional INFO String parameter can carry any meaningful 8-bit ASCII character string along with the message. Length of the INFO String parameter is from 0 to 255 characters. No procedures are presently identified for its use but the INFO String MAY be used for debugging purposes.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数可以携带任何有意义的8位ASCII字符串以及消息。信息字符串参数的长度为0到255个字符。目前还没有确定其使用的过程，但信息字符串可用于调试目的。

contents.text: 3.3.2.2 ASP Up Ack
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.2 ASP向上确认

contents.text: The ASP Up Ack message is used to acknowledge an ASP Up message received from a remote IUA peer.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Up Ack消息用于确认从远程IUA对等方接收到的ASP Up消息。

contents.text: The ASPUP Ack message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASUP Ack消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: INFO String (optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for ASPUP Ack Message parameters is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPUP Ack消息参数的格式如下：

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.3.1).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息的格式和说明相同（参见第3.3.3.1节）。

contents.text: 3.3.2.3 ASP Down (ASPDN)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.3 ASP关闭（ASPDN）

contents.text: The ASP Down (ASPDN) message is sent by an ASP to indicate to an SG that it is NOT ready to receive traffic or maintenance messages.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Down（ASPDN）消息由ASP发送，以指示SG尚未准备好接收流量或维护消息。

contents.text: The ASPDN message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPDN消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Reason INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 原因信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the ASPDN message parameters is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPDN消息参数的格式如下所示：

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.3.1.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息的格式和说明相同（见第3.3.3.1节）。

contents.text: The Reason parameter indicates the reason that the remote IUA adaptation layer is unavailable. The valid values for Reason are shown in the following table.
contents.zh-CHS: Reason参数表示远程IUA适配层不可用的原因。下表显示了合理的有效值。

contents.text: Value Description 0x1 Management Inhibit
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明0x1管理禁止

contents.text: If a ASP is removed from Management Inhibit, the ASP will send an ASP Up message.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果从管理禁止中删除ASP，则ASP将发送ASP Up消息。

contents.text: 3.3.2.4 ASP Down Ack
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.4 ASP向下确认

contents.text: The ASP Down Ack message is used to acknowledge an ASP Down message received from a remote IUA peer.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Down Ack消息用于确认从远程IUA对等方接收到的ASP Down消息。

contents.text: The ASP Down Ack message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Down Ack消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Reason INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 原因信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the ASP Down Ack message parameters is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Down Ack消息参数的格式如下：

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.2.1.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息相同（见第3.3.2.1节）。

contents.text: The format of the Reason parameter is the same as for the ASP Down message (See Section 3.3.2.3).
contents.zh-CHS: 原因参数的格式与ASP Down消息的格式相同（见第3.3.2.3节）。

contents.text: 3.3.2.5 ASP Active (ASPAC)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.5 ASP活动（ASPAC）

contents.text: The ASPAC message is sent by an ASP to indicate to an SG that it is Active and ready to be used.
contents.zh-CHS: ASPAC消息由ASP发送，以向SG指示其处于活动状态并准备好使用。

contents.text: The ASPAC message contains the following parameters
contents.zh-CHS: ASPAC消息包含以下参数

contents.text: Traffic Mode Type (Mandatory) Interface Identifier (Optional) - Combination of integer and integer ranges, OR - string (text formatted) INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 交通模式类型（必需）接口标识符（可选）-整数和整数范围的组合，或-字符串（文本格式）信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the ASPAC message using integer formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用整数格式接口标识符的ASPAC消息格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifiers* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x1 or 0x8 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型为0x1或0x8的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format for the ASPAC message using text formatted (string) Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用文本格式（字符串）接口标识符的ASPAC消息格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifier* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x3 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型0x3的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The Traffic Mode Type parameter identifies the traffic mode of operation of the ASP within an AS. The valid values for Type are shown in the following table:
contents.zh-CHS: Traffic Mode Type参数标识AS中ASP的运行流量模式。类型的有效值如下表所示：

contents.text: Value Description 0x1 Over-ride 0x2 Load-share
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明0x1超越0x2负载共享

contents.text: Within a particular Interface Identifier, only one Traffic Mode Type can be used. The Over-ride value indicates that the ASP is operating in Over-ride mode, where the ASP takes over all traffic in an Application Server (i.e., primary/back-up operation), over-riding any currently active ASPs in the AS. In Load-share mode, the ASP will share in the traffic distribution with any other currently active ASPs.
contents.zh-CHS: 在特定接口标识符中，只能使用一种通信模式类型。Over ride值表示ASP在Over ride模式下运行，在此模式下，ASP接管应用程序服务器中的所有流量（即主/备份操作），超过AS中任何当前活动的ASP。在负载共享模式下，ASP将与任何其他当前活动的ASP共享流量分布。

contents.text: The optional Interface Identifiers parameter contains a list of Interface Identifier integers (Type 0x1 or Type 0x8) or text strings (Type 0x3) indexing the Application Server traffic that the sending ASP is configured/registered to receive. If integer formatted
contents.zh-CHS: 可选的Interface Identifiers参数包含接口标识符整数（类型0x1或类型0x8）或文本字符串（类型0x3）列表，用于索引发送ASP配置/注册为接收的应用程序服务器流量。如果整数格式

contents.text: Interface Identifiers are being used, the ASP can also send ranges of Interface Identifiers (Type 0x8). Interface Identifier types Integer (0x1) and Integer Range (0x8) are allowed in the same message. Text formatted Interface Identifiers (0x3) cannot be used with either Integer (0x1) or Integer Range (0x8) types.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果正在使用接口标识符，ASP还可以发送接口标识符的范围（类型0x8）。同一消息中允许使用Integer（0x1）和Integer Range（0x8）接口标识符类型。文本格式的接口标识符（0x3）不能与整数（0x1）或整数范围（0x8）类型一起使用。

contents.text: If no Interface Identifiers are included, the message is for all provisioned Interface Identifiers within the AS(s) in which the ASP is provisioned. If only a subset of Interface Identifiers are included, the ASP is noted as Active for all the Interface Identifiers provisioned for that AS.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果未包括任何接口标识符，则该消息适用于配置ASP的AS中的所有已配置接口标识符。如果仅包括接口标识符的子集，则ASP对于为其设置的所有接口标识符都被视为活动的。

contents.text: Note: If the optional Interface Identifier parameter is present, the integer formatted Interface Identifier MUST be supported, while the text formatted Interface Identifier MAY be supported.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：如果存在可选接口标识符参数，则必须支持整数格式的接口标识符，而可能支持文本格式的接口标识符。

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.2.1.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息相同（见第3.3.2.1节）。

contents.text: An SG that receives an ASPAC with an incorrect Traffic Mode Type for a particular Interface Identifier will respond with an Error Message (Cause: Unsupported Traffic Handling Mode).
contents.zh-CHS: 接收到特定接口标识符的ASPAC的流量模式类型不正确的SG将响应错误消息（原因：不支持的流量处理模式）。

contents.text: 3.3.2.6 ASP Active Ack
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.6 ASP活动确认

contents.text: The ASPAC Ack message is used to acknowledge an ASP-Active message received from a remote IUA peer.
contents.zh-CHS: ASPAC Ack消息用于确认从远程IUA对等方接收到的ASP活动消息。

contents.text: The ASPAC Ack message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPAC Ack消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Traffic Mode Type (Mandatory) Interface Identifier (Optional) - Combination of integer and integer ranges, OR - string (text formatted) INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 交通模式类型（必需）接口标识符（可选）-整数和整数范围的组合，或-字符串（文本格式）信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the ASPAC Ack message with Integer-formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 带有整数格式接口标识符的ASPAC Ack消息格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifiers* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x1 or 0x8 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型为0x1或0x8的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format for the ASP Active Ack message using text formatted (string) Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用文本格式（字符串）接口标识符的ASP活动确认消息的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifier* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x3 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型0x3的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format of the Traffic Mode Type and Interface Identifier parameters is the same as for the ASP Active message (See Section 3.3.2.5).
contents.zh-CHS: 流量模式类型和接口标识符参数的格式与ASP活动消息的格式相同（见第3.3.2.5节）。

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.2.1.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息相同（见第3.3.2.1节）。

contents.text: 3.3.2.7 ASP Inactive (ASPIA)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.7 ASP非活动（ASPIA）

contents.text: The ASPIA message is sent by an ASP to indicate to an SG that it is no longer an active ASP to be used from within a list of ASPs. The SG will respond with an ASPIA Ack message and either discard incoming messages or buffer for a timed period and then discard.
contents.zh-CHS: ASPIA消息由ASP发送，以指示SG它不再是要从ASP列表中使用的活动ASP。SG将使用ASPIA Ack消息进行响应，并在一段时间内丢弃传入消息或缓冲区，然后丢弃。

contents.text: The ASPIA message contains the following parameters
contents.zh-CHS: ASPIA消息包含以下参数

contents.text: Traffic Mode Type (Mandatory) Interface Identifiers (Optional) - Combination of integer and integer ranges, OR - string (text formatted)
contents.zh-CHS: 交通模式类型（必需）接口标识符（可选）-整数和整数范围的组合，或-字符串（文本格式）

contents.text: INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the ASP Inactive message parameters using Integer formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用整数格式接口标识符的ASP非活动消息参数的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifiers* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x1 or 0x8 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型为0x1或0x8的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format for the ASP Inactive message using text formatted (string) Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用文本格式（字符串）接口标识符的ASP非活动消息的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifier* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x3 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型0x3的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The Traffic Mode Type parameter identifies the traffic mode of operation of the ASP within an AS. The valid values for Traffic Mode Type are shown in the following table:
contents.zh-CHS: Traffic Mode Type参数标识AS中ASP的运行流量模式。交通模式类型的有效值如下表所示：

contents.text: Value Description 0x1 Over-ride 0x2 Load-share
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明0x1超越0x2负载共享

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Interface Identifiers and Info String parameters is the same as for the ASP Active message (See Section 3.3.2.3.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选接口标识符和信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP活动消息的格式和说明相同（见第3.3.2.3节）。

contents.text: The optional Interface Identifiers parameter contains a list of Interface Identifier integers or text strings indexing the Application Server traffic that the sending ASP is configured/registered to receive, but does not want to receive at this time.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选接口标识符参数包含接口标识符整数或文本字符串列表，这些整数或文本字符串索引发送ASP配置/注册为接收但此时不希望接收的应用程序服务器流量。

contents.text: 3.3.2.8 ASP Inactive Ack
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.8 ASP非活动确认

contents.text: The ASP Inactive (ASPIA) Ack message is used to acknowledge an ASP Inactive message received from a remote IUA peer.
contents.zh-CHS: ASP Inactive（ASPIA）Ack消息用于确认从远程IUA对等方接收到的ASP Inactive消息。

contents.text: The ASPIA Ack message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: ASPIA Ack消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Traffic Mode Type (Mandatory) Interface Identifiers (Optional) - Combination of integer and integer ranges, OR - string (text formatted) INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 交通模式类型（必需）接口标识符（可选）-整数和整数范围的组合，或-字符串（文本格式）信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: | Interface Identifiers* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x1 or 0x8 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型为0x1或0x8的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format for the ASP Inactive Ack message using text formatted (string) Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 使用文本格式（字符串）接口标识符的ASP非活动确认消息的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifier* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x3 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型0x3的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format of the Traffic Mode Type and Interface Identifier parameters is the same as for the ASP Inactive message (See Section 3.3.2.7).
contents.zh-CHS: 流量模式类型和接口标识符参数的格式与ASP非活动消息的格式相同（见第3.3.2.7节）。

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Info String parameter is the same as for the ASP Up message (See Section 3.3.2.1).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP Up消息的格式和说明相同（见第3.3.2.1节）。

contents.text: 3.3.2.9 Heartbeat (BEAT)

The Heartbeat message is optionally used to ensure that the IUA peers are still available to each other. It is recommended for use when the IUA runs over a transport layer other than the SCTP, which has its own heartbeat.
contents.zh-CHS: 心跳消息可选择性地用于确保IUA对等点彼此仍然可用。当IUA运行在SCTP以外的传输层时，建议使用它，因为SCTP有自己的心跳信号。

contents.text: The BEAT message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: 节拍消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Heartbeat Data Optional
contents.zh-CHS: 心跳数据可选

contents.text: The format for the BEAT message is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 节拍信息的格式如下：

contents.text: The Heartbeat Data parameter contents are defined by the sending node. The Heartbeat Data could include, for example, a Heartbeat Sequence Number and, or Timestamp. The receiver of a Heartbeat message does not process this field as it is only of significance to the sender. The receiver MUST respond with a Heartbeat Ack message.
contents.zh-CHS: 心跳数据参数内容由发送节点定义。心跳数据可以包括例如心跳序列号和/或时间戳。心跳消息的接收者不处理此字段，因为它仅对发送者重要。接收器必须以心跳确认消息进行响应。

contents.text: 3.3.2.10 Heartbeat Ack (BEAT-Ack)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.2.10 心跳确认（心跳确认）

contents.text: The Heartbeat Ack message is sent in response to a received Heartbeat message. It includes all the parameters of the received Heartbeat message, without any change.
contents.zh-CHS: Heartbeat Ack消息是响应接收到的Heartbeat消息而发送的。它包括接收到的心跳消息的所有参数，没有任何更改。

contents.text: 3.3.3 Layer Management (MGMT) Messages
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.3 层管理（MGMT）消息

contents.text: 3.3.3.1 Error (ERR)

The Error message is used to notify a peer of an error event associated with an incoming message. For example, the message type might be unexpected given the current state, or a parameter value might be invalid.
contents.zh-CHS: 错误消息用于通知对等方与传入消息关联的错误事件。例如，给定当前状态，消息类型可能是意外的，或者参数值可能无效。

contents.text: The Error message will only have the common message header. The Error message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: 错误消息将仅具有公共消息头。错误消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Error Code Diagnostic Information (optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 错误代码诊断信息（可选）

contents.text: | Diagnostic Information* |
contents.zh-CHS: |诊断信息*|

contents.text: The Error Code parameter indicates the reason for the Error Message. The Error parameter value can be one of the following values:
contents.zh-CHS: Error Code参数指示错误消息的原因。错误参数值可以是以下值之一：

contents.text: Invalid Version 0x01 Invalid Interface Identifier 0x02 Unsupported Message Class 0x03 Unsupported Message Type 0x04 Unsupported Traffic Handling Mode 0x05 Unexpected Message 0x06 Protocol Error 0x07 Unsupported Interface Identifier Type 0x08 Invalid Stream Identifier 0x09 Unassigned TEI 0x0a Unrecognized SAPI 0x0b Invalid TEI, SAPI combination 0x0c
contents.zh-CHS: 无效版本0x01无效接口标识符0x02不支持的消息类0x03不支持的消息类型0x04不支持的流量处理模式0x05意外消息0x06协议错误0x07不支持的接口标识符类型0x08无效流标识符0x09未分配的TEI 0x0a未识别的SAPI 0x0b无效TEI，SAPI组合0x0c

contents.text: The "Invalid Version" error would be sent if a message was received with an invalid or unsupported version. The Error message would contain the supported version in the Common header. The Error message could optionally provide the supported version in the Diagnostic Information area.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果收到的消息版本无效或不受支持，则会发送“无效版本”错误。错误消息将在公共标头中包含受支持的版本。错误消息可以在诊断信息区域提供支持的版本。

contents.text: The "Invalid Interface Identifier" error would be sent by a SG if an ASP sends a message with an invalid (unconfigured) Interface Identifier value.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果ASP发送带有无效（未配置）接口标识符值的消息，则SG将发送“无效接口标识符”错误。

contents.text: The "Unsupported Traffic Handling Mode" error would be sent by a SG if an ASP sends an ASP Active with an unsupported Traffic Handling Mode. An example would be a case in which the SG did not support load-sharing.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果ASP以不支持的流量处理模式发送ASP活动，则SG将发送“不支持的流量处理模式”错误。例如，SG不支持负载共享。

contents.text: The "Unexpected Message" error would be sent by an ASP if it received a QPTM message from an SG while it was in the Inactive state (the ASP could optionally drop the message and not send an Error). It would
contents.zh-CHS: 如果ASP在非活动状态下收到来自SG的QPTM消息，则ASP将发送“意外消息”错误（ASP可以选择删除消息而不发送错误）。会的

contents.text: also be sent by an ASP if it received a defined and recognized message that the SG is not expected to send (e.g., if the MGC receives an IUA Establish Request message).
contents.zh-CHS: 如果ASP接收到SG不希望发送的已定义和已识别的消息（例如，如果MGC接收到IUA建立请求消息），ASP也会发送该消息。

contents.text: The "Protocol Error" error would be sent for any protocol anomaly (i.e., a bogus message).
contents.zh-CHS: 对于任何协议异常（即虚假消息），都会发送“协议错误”错误。

contents.text: The "Invalid Stream Identifier" error would be sent if a message was received on an unexpected SCTP stream (i.e., a MGMT message was received on a stream other than "0").
contents.zh-CHS: 如果在意外的SCTP流上接收到消息（即，在“0”以外的流上接收到管理消息），则将发送“无效流标识符”错误。

contents.text: The "Unsupported Interface Identifier Type" error would be sent by a SG if an ASP sends a Text formatted Interface Identifier and the SG only supports Integer formatted Interface Identifiers. When the ASP receives this error, it will need to resend its message with an Integer formatted Interface Identifier.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果ASP发送文本格式的接口标识符，且SG仅支持整数格式的接口标识符，则SG将发送“不支持的接口标识符类型”错误。当ASP收到此错误时，需要使用整数格式的接口标识符重新发送其消息。

contents.text: The "Unsupported Message Type" error would be sent if a message with an unexpected or unsupported Message Type is received.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果收到具有意外或不支持的消息类型的消息，则会发送“不支持的消息类型”错误。

contents.text: The "Unsupported Message Class" error would be sent if a message with an unexpected or unsupported Message Class is received.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果收到包含意外或不支持的消息类的消息，则会发送“不支持的消息类”错误。

contents.text: The "Unassigned TEI" error may be used when the SG receives an IUA message that includes a TEI which has not been assigned or recognized for use on the indicated ISDN D-channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 当SG接收到IUA消息时，可能会使用“未分配TEI”错误，该IUA消息包括尚未分配或识别用于指示ISDN D信道的TEI。

contents.text: The "Unrecognized SAPI" error would handle the case of using a SAPI that is not recognized by the SG. The "Invalid TEI, SAPI combination" error identify errors where the TEI is assigned and the the SAPI is recognized, but the combination is not valid for the interface (e.g., on a BRI the MGC tries to send Q.921 Management messages via IUA when Layer Management at the SG SHOULD be performing this function).
contents.zh-CHS: “Unrecognized SAPI”错误将处理使用SG无法识别的SAPI的情况。“无效TEI，SAPI组合”错误识别分配TEI且识别SAPI的错误，但组合对接口无效（例如，在BRI上，当SG的层管理应执行此功能时，MGC尝试通过IUA发送Q.921管理消息）。

contents.text: The optional Diagnostic information can be any information germane to the error condition, to assist in identification of the error condition. To enhance debugging, the Diagnostic information could contain the first 40 bytes of the offending message.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选诊断信息可以是与错误状况相关的任何信息，以帮助识别错误状况。为了增强调试，诊断信息可以包含出错消息的前40个字节。

contents.text: 3.3.3.2 Notify (NTFY)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.3.2 通知（NTFY）

contents.text: The Notify message used to provide an autonomous indication of IUA events to an IUA peer.
contents.zh-CHS: 用于向IUA对等方提供IUA事件的自主指示的通知消息。

contents.text: The Notify message will only use the common message header. The Notify message contains the following parameters:
contents.zh-CHS: 通知消息将仅使用公共消息头。通知消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: Status Type Status Identification Interface Identifiers (Optional) INFO String (Optional)
contents.zh-CHS: 状态类型状态标识接口标识符（可选）信息字符串（可选）

contents.text: The format for the Notify message with Integer-formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 带有整数格式接口标识符的Notify消息的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifiers* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x1 or 0x8 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型为0x1或0x8的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The format for the Notify message with Text-formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 带有文本格式接口标识符的Notify消息的格式如下：

contents.text: | Interface Identifier* |
contents.zh-CHS: |接口标识符*|

contents.text: | Additional Interface Identifiers | | of Tag Type 0x3 |
contents.zh-CHS: |标签类型0x3的附加接口标识符| ||

contents.text: | INFO String* |
contents.zh-CHS: |信息字符串*|

contents.text: The Status Type parameter identifies the type of the Notify message. The following are the valid Status Type values:
contents.zh-CHS: Status Type参数标识通知消息的类型。以下是有效的状态类型值：

contents.text: Value Description 0x1 Application Server state change (AS_State_Change) 0x2 Other
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明0x1应用程序服务器状态更改（作为状态更改）0x2其他

contents.text: The Status Identification parameter contains more detailed information for the notification, based on the value of the Status Type. If the Status Type is AS_State_Change the following Status Identification values are used:
contents.zh-CHS: Status Identification参数根据状态类型的值包含通知的更详细信息。如果状态类型为AS_State_Change，则使用以下状态标识值：

contents.text: Value Description 1 Application Server Down (AS_Down) 2 Application Server Inactive (AS_Inactive) 3 Application Server Active (AS_Active) 4 Application Server Pending (AS_Pending)
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明1应用程序服务器关闭（AS_关闭）2应用程序服务器不活动（AS_不活动）3应用程序服务器活动（AS_活动）4应用程序服务器挂起（AS_挂起）

contents.text: These notifications are sent from an SG to an ASP upon a change in status of a particular Application Server. The value reflects the new state of the Application Server.
contents.zh-CHS: 当特定应用服务器的状态发生变化时，这些通知从SG发送到ASP。该值反映应用程序服务器的新状态。

contents.text: If the Status Type is Other, then the following Status Information values are defined:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果状态类型为“其他”，则定义以下状态信息值：

contents.text: Value Description 1 Insufficient ASP resources active in AS 2 Alternate ASP Active
contents.zh-CHS: 值说明1中活动的ASP资源不足，2备用ASP处于活动状态

contents.text: These notifications are not based on the SG reporting the state change of an ASP or AS. In the Insufficient ASP Resources case, the SG is indicating to an "Inactive" ASP(s) in the AS that another ASP is required in order to handle the load of the AS (Load-sharing mode). For the Alternate ASP Active case, an ASP is informed when an alternate ASP transitions to the ASP-Active state in Over-ride mode.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些通知并非基于报告ASP或AS状态更改的SG。在ASP资源不足的情况下，SG向AS中的“非活动”ASP指示需要另一个ASP来处理AS的负载（负载共享模式）。对于备用ASP激活情况，当备用ASP在超车模式下转换为ASP激活状态时，会通知ASP。

contents.text: The format and description of the optional Interface Identifiers and Info String parameters is the same as for the ASP Active message (See Section 3.3.2.3.).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选接口标识符和信息字符串参数的格式和说明与ASP活动消息的格式和说明相同（见第3.3.2.3节）。

contents.text: 3.3.3.3 TEI Status Messages (Request, Confirm and Indication)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3.3.3 TEI状态消息（请求、确认和指示）

contents.text: The TEI Status messages are exchanged between IUA layer peers to request, confirm and indicate the status of a particular TEI.
contents.zh-CHS: TEI状态消息在IUA层对等方之间交换，以请求、确认和指示特定TEI的状态。

contents.text: The TEI Status messages contain the common message header followed by IUA message header. The TEI Status Request message does not contain any additional parameters.
contents.zh-CHS: TEI状态消息包含公共消息头，后跟IUA消息头。TEI状态请求消息不包含任何其他参数。

contents.text: In the integrated ISDN Layer 2/3 model (e.g., in traditional ISDN switches), it is assumed that the Layer Management for the Q.921 Layer and the Q.931 layer are co-located. When backhauling ISDN, this assumption is not necessarily valid. The TEI status messages allow the two Layer Management entities to communicate the status of the TEI. In addition, knowing that a TEI is in service allows the ASP to request the SG to establish the datalink to the terminal (via the IUA Establish message) for signaling if the ASP wants to be in control of data link establishment. Another use of the TEI status procedure is where the Layer Management at the ASP can prepare for send/receive signaling to/from a given TEI and confirm/verify the establishment of a datalink to that TEI. For example, if a datalink is established for a TEI that the ASP did not know was assigned, the ASP can check to see whether it was assigned or whether there was an error in the signaling message. Also, knowing that a TEI is out of service, the ASP need not request the SG to establish a datalink to that TEI.
contents.zh-CHS: 在综合ISDN第2/3层模型中（例如，在传统ISDN交换机中），假定Q.921层和Q.931层的层管理位于同一位置。当回传ISDN时，这种假设不一定有效。TEI状态消息允许两层管理实体通信TEI的状态。此外，知道TEI正在服务中允许ASP请求SG建立到终端的数据链路（通过IUA建立消息），以便在ASP想要控制数据链路建立时发信号。TEI状态过程的另一个用途是，ASP处的层管理可以准备向给定TEI发送/接收信令，并确认/验证到该TEI的数据链路的建立。例如，如果为ASP不知道已分配的TEI建立了数据链路，则ASP可以检查该TEI是否已分配或信令消息中是否存在错误。此外，知道TEI已停止服务，ASP无需请求SG建立到该TEI的数据链路。

contents.text: The TEI Status Indication, and Confirm messages contain the following parameter:
contents.zh-CHS: TEI状态指示和确认消息包含以下参数：

contents.text: STATUS
contents.zh-CHS: 地位

contents.text: The valid values for Status are shown in the following table.
contents.zh-CHS: 下表显示了状态的有效值。

contents.text: Define Value Description ASSIGNED 0x0 TEI is considered assigned by Q.921 UNASSIGNED 0x1 TEI is considered unassigned by Q.921
contents.zh-CHS: 定义值说明分配0x0 TEI被认为是由Q.921分配的未分配0x1 TEI被认为是由Q.921分配的

contents.text: 4.0 Procedures
contents.zh-CHS: 4.0 程序

contents.text: The IUA layer needs to respond to various primitives it receives from other layers as well as messages it receives from the peer IUA layer. This section describes various procedures involved in response to these events.
contents.zh-CHS: IUA层需要响应从其他层接收的各种原语以及从对等IUA层接收的消息。本节描述了应对这些事件所涉及的各种程序。

contents.text: 4.1 Procedures to support service in section 1.4.1
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1 第1.4.1节中支持服务的程序

contents.text: These procedures achieve the IUA layer's "Transport of Q.921/Q.931 boundary" service.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些程序实现了IUA层的“Q.921/Q.931边界传输”服务。

contents.text: 4.1.1 Q.921 or Q.931 primitives procedures
